required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tradeoff Between Spatial and Temporal Resolution
clinical_study.official_title: Tradeoff Between Spatial Resolution of Neural Excitation and Temporal Rate Processing

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, investigators will examine how temporal rate processing might be affected when the width of neural excitation narrows. The manipulation of neural excitation width will be achieved for example by changing electrode configurations or stimulating single versus multiple electrodes simultaneously. Investigators will then measure if the extent to which rate processing is affected by spatially restricted stimulation can predict a subject's overall speech recognition and predict also whether the subject is likely to benefit from a focused electrode configuration. Lastly, investigators will introduce and test a novel current focusing strategy where current focusing is applied in a channel specific manner and quantify if this intervention improves speech recognition. The primary endpoint of the study is speech recognition, and the secondary endpoint is psychophysical sensitivity to stimulation rate change.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity to stimulation rate change at threshold
primary_outcome.time_frame: starting 6 months post award notice and will take up to 4 years to complete
primary_outcome.description: Subjects' psychophysical detection thresholds will be measured as a function of the rate of stimulation delivered to selected electrodes and selected electrode configuration

primary_outcome.time_frame: starting 6 months post award notice and will take up to 4 years to complete
primary_outcome.description: subjects' ability to discriminate stimulation rates will be measured as a function of base stimulation rates at selected electrodes and selected electrode configuration.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: starting 6 months post award notice and will take up to 4 years to complete
secondary_outcome.description: Speech recognition in quiet and in noise will be measured under three conditions: 1. the traditional monopolar electrode configuration; 2. using current focusing on electrodes that show good sensitivity to rate change; 3. using current focusing on all electrodes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cochlear implant users with Nucleus and AB devices
arm_group.description: Temporal processing acuity will be compared using electrodes or electrode configurations that create broad versus sharp spatial excitation. Speech recognition will be compared in the same group of subjects using electrode-dependent focused versus monopolar stimulation.

intervention.description: Electrodes will be chosen based on their spatial tuning curves. Focused stimulation will be applied to electrodes with good temporal processing acuity.
intervention.arm_group_label: Cochlear implant users with Nucleus and AB devices

study_pop.textblock: Children and adults received cochlear implants (Advanced Bionics and Cochlear Nucleus devices).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Native speakers of English
- Cochlear Nucleus cochlear implant users or Advanced Bionics users
- Postlingually deafened
- Has had device experience for at least one year
- Can be child or adult at the time of enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Department of Communication Sciences and Disorders, ECU
